result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlone Deshawn Winfield

records.addlTxt: $1,000 cash bond amended to $400 cash bond; No contact with phone owner, LAB

Motion to Modify Bond-Same appearances.  Atty. Parham argues for bail modification.  State indicates the motion may be moot as there is a revocation hearing scheduled in next couple of weeks and is on a PO hold for 18CF4067.  Court

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Marlone Deshawn Winfield in court, in custody.  Attorney Gillion Parham in court for Marlone Deshawn Winfield.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered to all 3 counts.  Court amends the bond to $400.00 cash bond.
Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prior: 2833 Riverside Dr, Green Bay, WI 54301
Bail/bond hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion & Motion to Modify Bond

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Marlone Deshawn Winfield in court, in custody.  Attorney Gillion Parham in court for Marlone Deshawn Winfield.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  WITNESS:  Lieutenant Tim Kemps (WCSO).  State rests.  State moves for bind over.  Atty. Parham argues to Dismiss Count 1 and to Dismiss Count 2.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and bind the defendant over for trial.  State shall file an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
No contact with phone owner LAB

Clerk BMC; Defendant Marlone Deshawn Winfield appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laykin Stone in court for Marlone Deshawn Winfield.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def requests to appear in person. Case recalled at 3:38 PM. Def now appears in person. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. SPD will represent the Def. State requests $5,000 cash bond. Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond. Def does not waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
